alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windsor; Western Rutland (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 12 at 4:07AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Dry Fuels and Low Relative Humidity will Increase Fire Weather Concerns Today across Parts of Southern Vermont... Fine fuels remain very dry according to the Vermont Department of Forests, Parks and Recreation, while near critically low relative humidity values in the 25 to 35 percent range will develop across portions of western Rutland and eastern Windsor Counties today. These conditions will combine with west to northwest winds of 10 to 15 mph with localized gusts of 15 to 25 mph to increase the fire weather concerns across the region. If any fires were to start, the weather and localized fuel conditions may result in rapid fire spread. For more information about the current fire danger rating, any burn restrictions, and wildfire prevention and education, please visit your state forestry or environmental protection website.
